1.name: Mad Love
1.description: In France, an insane surgeon's obsession with an actress from England leads him to replace her pianist husband's hands that got mangled in an accident with the hands of a late knife murderer which still have the urge to throw knives.

2.name: Bride of Frankenstein
2.description: Mary Shelley reveals the main characters of her novel survived: Dr. Frankenstein, goaded by an even madder scientist, builds his monster a mate.

3.name: The 39 Steps
3.description: A man in London tries to help a counter-espionage Agent. But when the Agent is killed, and the man stands accused, he must go on the run to save himself and stop a spy ring which is trying to steal top secret information.

4.name: I Found Stella Parish
4.description: A theatrical star abruptly leaves England to escape her secret past, while a newspaper reporter follows her trail to America to get the scoop.

5.name: Captain Blood
5.description: After being wrongly convicted as a traitor, Peter Blood, an English physician, is sent to exile in the British colonies of the Caribbean, where he becomes a pirate.

6.name: A Night at the Opera
6.description: A sly business manager and two wacky friends of two opera singers help them achieve success while humiliating their stuffy and snobbish enemies.

7.name: Anna Karenina
7.description: The married Anna Karenina falls in love with Count Vronsky despite her husband's refusal to grant a divorce, and both must contend with the social repercussions.

8.name: Mutiny on the Bounty
8.description: A tyrannical ship captain decides to exact revenge on his abused crew after they form a mutiny against him, but the sailor he targets had no hand in it.

9.name: Top Hat
9.description: An American dancer comes to Britain and falls for a model whom he initially annoyed, but she mistakes him for his goofy producer.

10.name: Les Misérables
10.description: In early 19th Century France an ex-convict who failed to report to parole is relentlessly pursued over a 20 year period by an obsessive policeman.

11.name: Call of the Wild
11.description: During the Klondike Gold Rush, a traveler purchases a dog to lead the way toward the treasure, but reconsiders his journey when he finds a jilted married woman.

12.name: A Tale of Two Cities
12.description: A pair of lookalikes, one a former French aristocrat and the other an alcoholic English lawyer, fall in love with the same woman amongst the turmoil of the French Revolution.

13.name: Roberta
13.description: In Paris, a man clueless about fashion suddenly inherits his aunt's dress shop, while his bandleader friend reunites with his old flame.

14.name: Living on Velvet
14.description: Terry Parker (George Brent) is shattered by the crash of his airplane which killed his parents and sister, and adopts a listless attitude toward life. But romance enters in the person of ...                See full summary »

15.name: Sylvia Scarlett
15.description: Escaping to England from a French embezzlement charge, widower Henry Scarlett is accompanied by daughter Sylvia who, to avoid detection, "disguises" herself as a boy, "Sylvester." They are ...                See full summary »

16.name: Werewolf of London
16.description: The juice of a rare Tibetan flower is the only thing that keeps Dr. Glendon from turning into a werewolf during a full moon.

17.name: David Copperfield
17.description: A gentle orphan discovers life and love in an indifferent adult world.

18.name: A Midsummer Night's Dream
18.description: Theseus, Duke of Athens, is going to marry Hyppolyta, Queen of the Amazons. Demetrius is engaged with Hermia, but Hermia loves Lysander. Helena loves Demetrius. Oberon and Titania, of the ...                See full summary »

19.name: Alice Adams
19.description: The misadventures of two social-climbing women in small town America.

20.name: Carnival in Flanders
20.description: Tells the story of the Spanish invasion of Flanders

21.name: The Informer
21.description: In 1922, an Irish rebel informs on his friend, then feels doom closing in.

22.name: Crime and Punishment
22.description: Man is haunted by a murder he's committed.

23.name: She
23.description: Leo Vincey, told by his dying uncle of a lost land visited 500 years ago by his ancestor, heads out with family friend Horace Holly to try to discover the land and its secret of immortality...                See full summary »

24.name: The Last Days of Pompeii
24.description: In the doomed Roman city, a gentle blacksmith becomes a corrupt gladiator, while his son leans toward Christianity.

25.name: The Irish in Us
25.description: Two brothers, a police officer and a boxing promoter, vie for the affections of a lovely young woman.

26.name: Dante's Inferno
26.description: Jim Carter moves in on the McWade's carnival concession which shows scenes from Dante's "Inferno". He makes it a going concern, marrying Betty along the way. An inspector calls the ...                See full summary »

27.name: Becky Sharp
27.description: Set against the background of the Battle of Waterloo, Becky Sharp is the story of Vanity Fair by Thackeray. Becky and Amelia are girls at school together, but Becky is from a "show biz" ...                See full summary »

28.name: She Married Her Boss
28.description: A super-efficient secretary at a department store falls for and marries her boss, but finds out that taking care of him at home (and especially his spoiled-brat daughter) is a lot different from taking care of him at work.

29.name: The Case of the Lucky Legs
29.description: A con man who stages phony "lucky legs" beauty contests and leaves town with the money is found with a surgical knife in his heart by Mason.

30.name: The Raven
30.description: A brilliant surgeon obsessed with Edgar Allan Poe saves the life of a beautiful dancer and goes mad when he can't have her.

31.name: Dangerous
31.description: An alcoholic actress who is considered a dangerous jinx is rehabilitated, but she then shows that she's as dangerous as ever.

32.name: The Case of the Curious Bride
32.description: Perry interrupts his vacation plans when an ex-girlfriend, now newly married, asks him to help her with murder and bigamy charges.

33.name: Charlie Chan in Egypt
33.description: While investigating the theft of antiquities from an ancient tomb excavation, Charlie discovers that the body of the expedition's leader concealed inside the mummy's wrappings.

34.name: 'G' Men
34.description: It's the early days of the F.B.I. - federal agents working for the Department of Justice. Though they've got limited powers - they don't carry weapons and have to get local police approval ...                See full summary »

35.name: Suicide Squad
35.description: Larry Baker is a young fireman whose daring exploits have led him to receiving a lot of newspaper publicity which goes to his head. His sweetheart, Mary O'Connor, and fire-department ...                See full summary »

36.name: The Little Colonel
36.description: After Southern belle Elizabeth Lloyd runs off to marry Yankee Jack Sherman, her father, a former Confederate colonel during the Civil War, vows to never speak to her again. Several years ...                See full summary »

37.name: China Seas
37.description: When earthy Dolly Portland is rejected by Captain Gaskell in favor of a socialite, she aids Jamesy McCardle, in league with Malay pirates, in his plot to seize his ship.

38.name: Bonnie Scotland
38.description: Stan and Ollie mistakenly enlist in the army and find themselves posted to the Northwest Frontier in India on a dangerous mission.

39.name: The Dawn Rider
39.description: When John Mason's father is killed, John is wounded. Attracted to his nurse Alice, a conflict arises between him and his friend Ben who plans to marry Alice. John later finds the killer of ...                See full summary »

40.name: Curly Top
40.description: Wealthy Edward Morgan becomes charmed with a curly-haired orphan and her pretty older sister Mary and arranges to adopt both under the alias of "Mr. Jones." As he spends more time with them, he soon finds himself falling in love with Mary.

41.name: Broadway Melody of 1936
41.description: Bob Gordon is staging a new Broadway Show, but he is short of money. He gets an offer of money by the young widow Lillian, if she can dance in his new show. Bert Keeler, a newspaper man, ...                See full summary »

42.name: The Littlest Rebel
42.description: Shirley Temple's father, a rebel officer, sneaks back to his rundown plantation to see his family and is arrested. A Yankee takes pity and sets up an escape. Everyone is captured and the ...                See full summary »

43.name: Charlie Chan in Shanghai
43.description: When a prominent official is murdered at a banquet honoring Charle Chan, the detective and son Lee team up to expose an opium-smuggling ring.

44.name: The Devil Is a Woman
44.description: A young man is warned by a captain about a temptress; nonetheless, he finds himself falling in love with her.

45.name: The Murder Man
45.description: When a crooked businessman is fatally shot, a hotshot New York newspaper reporter specializing in murder stories narrows in on the dead man's associate.

46.name: Murder on a Honeymoon
46.description: A schoolteacher and amateur sleuth suspects foul play when a fellow passenger on a sea-plane gets sick and dies.

47.name: Naughty Marietta
47.description: In order to avoid a prearranged marriage, a rebellious French princess sheds her identity and escapes to colonial New Orleans, where she finds an unlikely true love.

48.name: Gold Diggers of 1935
48.description: Romantic antics abound among the guests at a luxury hotel, including a stage director, an eccentric millionaire, and the daughter of a financial backer.

49.name: The Crusades
49.description: King Richard and the Third Crusade (1190-1192) are given the DeMille treatment with more spectacle than history.

50.name: The Good Fairy
50.description: A naive girl just out of a cloistered orphanage finds that being a 'good fairy' to strangers makes life awfully complicated.
